metadata.title: CVE-2019-19272 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in tls_verify_crl in ProFTPD before 1.3.6. Direct dereference of a NULL pointer (a variable initialized to NULL) leads to a crash when validating the certificate of a client connecting to the server in a TLS client/server mutual-authentication setup.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-19272` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

proftpd-basic - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-core - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-mod-crypto - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-mod-geoip - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-mod-ldap - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-mod-mysql - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-mod-odbc - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-mod-pgsql - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-mod-snmp - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-mod-sqlite - 1.3.6-6build2
proftpd-mod-wrap - 1.3.6-6build2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: proftpd-dfsg package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.6-6build2').
